marklogic.body:
I believe the point is that Scott inists government spending must be cut, yet offers nothing other than supposedly "duplicitous programs" as a place to start cutting; he also falsely claims the Ryan plan isn't austerity.
As for the solution, it's nothing but nonsense and blatant falsehoods. A "strong dollar" policy just gets us a bigger trade deficit, domestic oil production is up (not down) and a slash and Burn policy on our budget won't improve the economy here any more than it has in any other country that has tried it (UK, Italy, Spain, etc). Steve is by far the more honest of the two comments.
